III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 09/19/2024, a group of youth threatened to kill an autistic
youth that was recently placed at the facility.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 09/24/2024 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional details.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth A identified
two youths by nicknames that took his breakfast food. Youth A
stated this took place on 09/20/2024 and two female staff (does
not know their names) worked the shift. Youth A stated the same
two youths threatened to fight him, but the physical altercation did
not occur. Youth A then changed his statement and stated one of
the two youths punched his chest on 09/20/2024 after breakfast
by the entrance door. Youth A stated the two female staff working
did not witness this incident. Youth A stated after his meeting on
09/20/2024 with the same DHHS worker present during this
interview, he was moved to another unit and given another
breakfast tray to eat. Youth A did not have information about being
threatened on 09/19/2024. Youth A stated he did not have further
concerns and was excited to be discharged following this
interview.
Youth B was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth B was
identified by his nickname from previous investigations. Youth B
stated he knew Youth A and looked out for Youth A and the other
youths because Youth B is the unit leader. Youth B stated Youth A
was not bullied and did not trade food with other youths. Youth B
stated he was done talking because this did not involve him and
the interview ended.
Youth C was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth C was identified by his nickname by
Manager. Youth C stated he does not know Youth A. Youth C
stated he is not involved in bullying or trading food.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker because Manager identified
her as working first shift on Unit 3A on 09/20/2024. Staff 1 stated
she is assigned to Unit 3A and recalled Youth A. Staff 1 denied
knowledge of Youth A being physically threatened or bullied for
food. Staff 1 stated she never witnessed Youth A horseplaying
with the youths or having conflict with a youth. Staff 1 stated food
trades and food give aways are not permitted.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker because Manager identified
her as working first shift on Unit 3A on 09/20/2024. Staff 2 stated
she is assigned to Unit 3A and recalled Youth A. Staff 2 denied
knowledge of Youth A being physically threatened or bullied for
food. Staff 2 stated Youth A kept to himself, but sometimes
engaged with the youths in the common area without incident.
Staff 2 stated she witnessed Youth A give away his breakfast tray
once but does not recall the date or who Youth A gave it to. Staff 2
stated she redirected Youth A to take his breakfast tray back and
pulled Youth A to the side to discuss the incident. Staff 2 stated
she asked why Youth A gave away his breakfast tray and Youth A
said, “I don’t want this shit.” Staff 2 stated food trading is not
permitted and is closely monitored by staff.
Video
09/20/2024 video of Unit 3A was reviewed on 10/16/2024. No
video was found of Youth A being punched in the chest by the
unit’s entrance door. Video was seen of Youth A leaving the unit
around 9:40 AM with a male staff as two female staff stood by the
doorway with several youths. Two youths separately tapped Youth
A on the back of his left shoulder with their fingertips as he exited
the unit. Youth A did not flinch, look at the youth or say anything
when tapped on the shoulder. The time of this incident coincides
with Youth A’s 09/20/2024 interview with another DHHS Worker.
No video was found of Youth A giving his breakfast tray to another
youth on 09/20/2024.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention stated Youth A did not generate
any incident reports during his placement, which was from
09/17/2024 to 09/23/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for providing the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A. Youth A was immediately
transferred to another unit and provided a breakfast tray when
3

Wayne County Juvenile Detention was notified by another DHHS
worker of the allegations on 09/20/2024. Video review showed
Youth A was tapped on the back of his shoulder twice by two
separate youths when he exited the unit on 09/20/2024, but he did
not react in any manner. There is no video footage of Youth A
giving his breakfast food away or it being taken away from him on
09/20/2024.
CONSULTATION
Continue to discuss and monitor personal boundaries with the
youths.
Continue to monitor possible food exchanges between the youths.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
